snippet.title: 10 Things To Do across the region this week
snippet.content: 1. Buderim Street Party WHEN: WHERE: INFO: THE village comes alive for one huge night of fun and entertainment - the largest street party on the Sunshine Coast. This is an awesome night out for the whole family with street entertainment, music, food and fun organised by the Buderim Lions Club and the Rotary Club of Buderim. 2. Uncorked WHEN: WHERE: COST: PURPLE Palate and Finbars will be hosting Uncorked:Wine/Beer/Spirits Exhibition. Six exhibitors will show their alcoholic credentials through their wares. Special prices will be offered on the day. 3. Our Sunshine Coast Concert WHEN: WHERE: COST: MORE than 500 performers from local choirs and orchestras are in preparation for a concert celebrating the Sunshine Coast. The musical spectacular will be conducted by Kim Kirkman, who was the musical director of The Ten Tenors for six years. The concert will also feature performances by winners of the Songs the Sunshine Coast competition, Mason Hope and Michael Barry, and special performer and MC Darren Percival. 4. Nat Cole Trio tribute WHEN: WHERE: INFO: 5491 6017 COST: SUNSHINE Coast Jazz Club presents Dorian Mode's Unforgettable: a tribute to the Nat Cole Trio. While other teens were buying Cold Chisel and AC/DC records, Dorian Mode was spending his pocket money on Nat King Cole records. He spent his time imitating Nat's piano and vocal stylings. Dorian meticulously researched Nat's catalogue to choose 20 original trio arrangements to transcribe and weave into a show about Nat's life. 5. Trivia afternoon WHEN: WHERE: INFO: COST: MAROOCHYDORE Library is on the prowl for trivia buffs. Sunshine Coast Council invites trivia buffs to the Friends of Maroochydore Library Trivia Afternoon. Get together with family and friends to make up a table of six and enjoy a fun afternoon, exercise your brain and maybe win a prize. 6. Wanderings WHEN: WHERE: INFO: THE next exhibition at Wan'din'in art space will be Wanderings by local artist Katrin Terton. Terton's mixed-media and photographic works continue her focus on the tenuous and transient elements of our environment, on transformation and impermanence. 7. Schools' Drama Festival WHEN: WHERE: INFO: COST: KAWANA Waters State College is hosting the 3rd annual Sunshine Coast Schools' Drama Festival. The festival celebrates excellence in drama education, explores the actor's craft and students' use of characterisation, body and voice in the performance space. 8. Festival of Community Halls WHEN: WHERE: INFO: SMALL venues across the Sunshine Coast will be lighting up as part of the Festival of Community Halls to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the naming of the Sunshine Coast. Throughout August and September, more than 18 halls will host a series of unique events and activities and highlight the part halls play in a community. 9. The Australian AC/DC Show WHEN: WHERE: INFO: COST: ACCA DACCA presents The Australian AC/DC Show - not a tribute or cover band but a full-blown show. Witness the AC/DC of the Bon Scott era as well - covering the early days of High Voltage and Highway to Hell, plus the best of the Brian Johnson era from Back in Black to the present day. 10. From Mountains To The Sea WHEN: WHERE: COST: FROM The Mountains To The Sea: Sunshine Coast Stories brings together objects, artworks and memorabilia that span from ancient times through to the present day. The exhibition helps mark the 50th anniversary of the naming of the Sunshine Coast. Firefighters report smoke coming from building and are investigating Controversial Senator 'amazed' by concerns from elderly Allegations: Man came into bank armed, demanded money Inaugural Currie St Music Crawl was a great success What do a mountain climber and a five-course dinner have in common? A soul, funk and reggae outfit will headline Peregian Originals Appreciate floral beauty at the Maroochydore Orchid Society show Box of Birds art exhibition is coming to Art Nuvo, Buderim Sunshine Coast Jazz Club is set to present Diamonds of Swing PRISCILLA Presley will discuss Elvis during an Australian speaking The Presets will star at the Maroochy Music and Visual Arts Festival The Indee is seeking young actors for a new play about Peter Pan Upcoming shows target tastes from Shakespeare to Ten Tenors Key buildings and international interest set to be revealed Check out this weekend's homes open for inspection. Stand-alone freehold property in Maroochydore 'eat street' precinct Australia's most unique house 'impossible to value'
